intro: Spermacoce brachystema var. majoriflora, commonly known as the large-flowered bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the wet season. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release tiny seeds when mature. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in humid, shaded environments.
